activities.loc: JCB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randall Frion

records.addlTxt:
Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with W.F.
Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages including wine, liquor, or beer. 
Must not possess firearms. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold for consumption on the premises, except for employment purposes.

07/29/2022 AMENDED: COURT GRANTS THE DEFENDANT TO RETURN ONE TIME WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT TO THE RESIDENCE TO OBTAIN PERSONAL BELONGINGS WHICH THE VICTIM WILL HAVE TOGETHER BASED UPON THE LIST PROVIDED BY THE ATTORNEY FROM THE DEFENDANT TO THE VICTIM. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

10/07/2022 AMENDED: COURT MODIFIES THE BOND FROM MUST HAVE NO CONTACT TO MUST HAVE NO ABUSIVE CONTACT WITH W.F.. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

1:24 PM Defendant Randall Frion in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Randall Frion.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Erdman requests bond modification.
State requests the bond continue as ordered.
Court amends bond to must have no abusive contact.
Bail/bond hearing on October 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Letter from the victim to Judge Babler regarding the no contact order.

8:15 AM Defendant Randall Frion in court.  Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Randall Frion.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter appears by video.

8:15  Court relates and gives appearances.
8:16  Deputy David Hibbard called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
8:22  Cross by Atty. Erdman.
8:28  Court questions State.
8:28  State relates and makes argument.
8:31  Atty. Erdman makes argument.
8:34  Court finds probable cause; bound over.
Arraignment set; must appear in person.
Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for December 30, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

2:30 PM Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Randall Frion.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Randall Frion appeared by video. 

2:30  Court relates and gives appearances. Attorney Erdman has requested a substitution and court finds it is timely.
Court grants.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

1:42 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall Frion in court.
Public Defender has not found counsel.  Defendant requests bond modification  Court will attempt to address issue after its 1:30 hearing.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

1:58 Case recalled.  Prosecuting attorney Brady Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall Frion in court.
Court relates.  ADA Seidlitz relates DA is not opposed to modifying bond to no abusive contact.  Court denies request to modify bond.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report
Notice from Embrace to drop the no-contact condition on the bond.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with W.F.
Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages including wine, liquor, or beer. 
Must not possess firearms. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold for consumption on the premises, except for employment purposes.

07/29/2022 AMENDED: COURT GRANTS THE DEFENDANT TO RETURN ONE TIME WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT TO THE RESIDENCE TO OBTAIN PERSONAL BELONGINGS WHICH THE VICTIM WILL HAVE TOGETHER BASED UPON THE LIST PROVIDED BY THE ATTORNEY FROM THE DEFENDANT TO THE VICTIM. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

9:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Randall Frion in court. Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Randall Frion (for today only). 
Request for bond modification to allow to return one time with law enforcement to the residence to obtain personal belongings. A list is to be provided by Attorney Rockow to the victim to prepare the items requested. 

Amended bond to be signed.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with W.F.
Must not possess or consume any intoxicating beverages including wine, liquor, or beer. 
Must not possess firearms. 
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold for consumption on the premises, except for employment purposes.

2:01 PM Defendant Randall Frion appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Rockow appears by zoom video for today only. 
Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
